education.description: Explore qa automation using cucumber and gherkin with selenium

jobHistory.description: When I first began to work at Capita, it was in an accounts-related position courtesy of my previous job-history and ACCA training.  However, after auto­mating as much of my bau as possible using VB-coded macros in Excel, I began to teach myself how to improve the existing UNIX shell scripts, SQL queries & XSL coding that generated the source data. This allowed me to further auto­mate the  extr­action and manip­ulation of account data into precise accounting reports which were soon used by several other depart­ments within the company. And here I first fell in love with coding.

Using my experience from Capita with shell scripting and sql, my main respons­ibility within Smart­focus was to create bespoke etl packages using bash shell scripting and Oracle SQL. My team was also responsible for resolving support queries in relation to existing etl packages; many of which were recurring questions. As such I modified an existing php-based web support tool to allow users to answer the most common queries themselves, saving measurable work hours for my team.
learn about data web tool

In my most recent role I have been developing regression test pack­ages using bdd techniques with Selenium, Cucumber and Gherkin. Being my first time working with compiled code at work it has been an exciting learning curve which I have very much enjoyed. Most recently I also helped the main dev­elopment team by creating a java servlet application to generate monthly reports for the finance department.

projects.title: Data Web Tool
projects.description:
This php site compiles client-account setup information from multiple servers and applications into one compre­hensive dashboard page. Over the years I added extra modules to automate recurring processes and begin to standardise more ad-hoc actions; such as the ability to scope a new custom etl project and directly tag an authorisor on the related Jira ticket automatically

projects.title: Command-Line Helper
projects.description: In order to help non-technical users navigate the command-line more effectively, I created a simple and expandable tool accessible from the terminal, with customised man pages explai­ning shortcuts for etl-creation, file-system navig­ation, system space and perfor­mance checks, as well as tips on how to get on with, or avoid, the linux built-in functions of vi and grep.

projects.title: Badb Exports
projects.description:
As an exciting exercise to dive deeper into Java development outside of the QA remit, I was tasked to develop a self-service portal for the finance department. Utilising encrypted login authentication and user-access level security, the application uses servlets and a ui to allow the team to generate any one of four ad-hoc reports for themselves as required. Some of these reports are also cronned to run automatically for users to download at their convenience, with manager-level users able to modify the particular scheduling, or suspend the automatic generation of, any report and housekeeping as required.

projects.title: QA Regression Test Suite
projects.description: Working in a small international team, I helped to build a suite of automated regression tests that are deployed alongside regular platform releases to ensure reliable deployments using ci/cd practices
